Aave‚Äôs GHO Stablecoin Supply Hits $500M

EN

Aave's decentralized stablecoin GHO has reached a significant milestone with market capitalization exceeding $500 million, representing 245% growth since the start of 2025. The number of GHO holders has increased by approximately 300% to nearly 23,000. Aave has actively expanded GHO's usage through Savings GHO (sGHO), a yield-bearing version offering competitive returns of 5.52% APY‚Äîhigher than other stablecoins like USDC and USDT on the platform. This strategic expansion has positioned GHO ahead of other DeFi protocol-linked stablecoins like Curve's crvUSD and Hyperliquid's USDH, demonstrating Aave's continued dominance in the DeFi space.

Key Points

  • GHO stablecoin's market cap exceeds $500M with 245% growth since early 2025
  • Aave expanded GHO usage through Savings GHO offering competitive 5.52% APY
  • GHO outperforms other DeFi protocol stablecoins like crvUSD and USDH in market capitalization

Article

The stablecoin‚Äôs market cap almost tripled in 2025 alone. Aave ‚Äôs decentralized stablecoin GHO reached over $500 million in market capitalization, hitting a new milestone in adoption. According to data from CoinGecko, circulating supply has stayed above half a billion as of early February, and has grown more than 245% since the start of 2025. GHO‚Äôs market cap since 2025. Source: CoinGecko Data from analytics firm Token Terminal shows that GHO‚Äôs holder count also grew over the past year, now standing near the 23,000 mark, up roughly 300% since January 2025. The number of GHO holders. Source: Token Terminal The boost in stablecoin supply also reflects Aave‚Äôs push to expand GHO‚Äôs usage. In July, the protocol rolled out Savings GHO (sGHO), a yield-bearing version of GHO that lets users deposit the stablecoin into a vault to earn interest on their stablecoin savings. Later on, sGHO was integrated across Arbitrum, Base, and Gnosis, with different liquidity programs and incentive schemes on partner platforms like Bybit and Bitget. Stablecoins and supply APY on Aave. Source: Aave On top of that, Aave incentivizes GHO use directly by offering a comparatively higher yield on sGHO than for most other stablecoins on its platform. GHO holders can currently earn 5.52% APY on their deposits while, by comparison, the APY for lending Circle‚Äôs USDC is 3.7 %, and for Tether‚Äôs USDT is 2.65%. Staking USDC or USDT via Aave offers higher yields, but the staking rate for GHO is still a bit higher. Other DeFi Stablecoins Aave is the largest protocol in DeFi by total value locked (TVL), currently with over $30 billion on the protocol across 18 chains. GHO‚Äôs 2025 growth pushes it ahead of other DeFi protocol-linked stablecoins such as Curve‚Äôs crvUSD and Hyperliquid‚Äôs USDH. Curve launched its native stablecoin in 2023, and its current supply stands at about $307.5 million. Hyperliquid‚Äôs USDH launched in late September, after a heated competition to become the developer and issuer of the native stablecoin for the largest perpetuals DEX by volume. USDH‚Äôs supply has stayed around $20-25 million since then. Aave‚Äôs native token, AAVE, is up 2.4% today, but it‚Äôs down over 50% on the year.
